solution_line_template: There were an average of {morning_apples} + {afternoon_apples} = <<{morning_apples}+{afternoon_apples}={total_apples}>>{total_apples} apples.
Thus, Wendy gained {total_apples} x ${apple_price} = $<<{total_apples}*{apple_price}={apple_sales}>>{apple_sales} for selling apples.
And, she gained an additional {total_oranges} x ${orange_price} = $<<{total_oranges}*{orange_price}={orange_sales}>>{orange_sales} for selling oranges.
Therefore, her total sales for the day is ${apple_sales} + {orange_sales} = $<<{apple_sales}+{orange_sales}={total_sales}>>{total_sales}.
